meta.description: Choose your hunting style: Web-Builders trap and control, Active Hunters strike fast without webs, or Venomous predators apply deadly DoT to Webbed prey.

cards._comment: === WEB-BUILDERS (Control archetype) - Trap enemies with webs ===
cards.name: Crab Spider
cards.flavorText: Crab spiders can change color between white and yellow to match the flowers they ambush prey on.

cards.name: Cellar Spider
cards.flavorText: Cellar spiders vibrate their webs so fast when threatened they become an invisible blur ‚Äî a defense called whirling.

cards.name: Garden Spider
cards.flavorText: Garden spiders eat and recycle their entire web each night, rebuilding a new one before dawn.

cards.name: Cobweb Spider
cards.flavorText: Cobweb spiders use sticky gum-footed threads anchored to the ground to snare walking insects.

cards.name: Orb Weaver
cards.flavorText: Orb weavers build spiral webs coated in liquid silk droplets that act like tiny springs to absorb impact.

cards.name: Writing Spider
cards.flavorText: The zigzag silk pattern (stabilimentum) in their webs reflects UV light, possibly to lure pollinating insects.

cards.name: Golden Silk Orb-Weaver
cards.flavorText: Golden silk orb-weaver thread is tougher than Kevlar by weight and has been studied for use in body armor.

cards.name: Black Widow
cards.flavorText: Black widow venom is 15 times stronger than rattlesnake venom, but they inject only tiny amounts.

cards._comment: === ACTIVE HUNTERS (Aggro archetype) - Fast attackers, NO webs ===
cards.name: Jumping Spider
cards.flavorText: Jumping spiders have the sharpest vision of any arthropod ‚Äî their eyes rival a small mammal's in acuity.

cards.name: Wolf Spider
cards.flavorText: Wolf spider mothers carry hundreds of spiderlings on their backs until the young are ready to disperse.

cards.name: Camel Spider
cards.flavorText: Camel spiders can run up to 10 mph. They are not true spiders but solifuges ‚Äî a separate arachnid order.

cards.name: Sun Spider
cards.flavorText: Sun spiders use massive chelicerae ‚Äî up to a third of their body length ‚Äî to crush prey without venom.

cards.name: Fishing Spider
cards.flavorText: Fishing spiders detect prey by sensing ripples on the water surface, and can catch small fish and tadpoles.

cards.name: Lynx Spider
cards.flavorText: Lynx spiders are one of the few spiders that can spit venom, spraying it up to 20 cm to blind threats.

cards.name: Portia Spider
cards.flavorText: Portia spiders plan multi-step detours to ambush prey ‚Äî a cognitive feat unmatched among invertebrates.

cards.name: Huntsman Spider
cards.flavorText: Huntsman spiders have laterigrade legs that let them move sideways like crabs, reaching speeds over 1 m/s.

cards.name: Trapdoor Spider
cards.flavorText: Trapdoor spiders build silk-hinged burrow lids and detect prey by feeling vibrations through silk triplines.

cards.name: Mouse Spider
cards.flavorText: Mouse spiders have huge fangs relative to body size and venom potent enough to require antivenom treatment.

cards.name: Purseweb Spider
cards.flavorText: Purseweb spiders stab prey through their sealed silk tube from inside, never leaving their burrow to hunt.

cards.name: Bark Scorpion
cards.flavorText: Bark scorpions can climb walls and ceilings. Their venom causes intense pain via sodium channel toxins.

cards.name: Brown Recluse
cards.flavorText: Brown recluse venom contains sphingomyelinase D, which destroys cell membranes and causes tissue necrosis.

cards.name: Scorpion
cards.flavorText: Scorpions glow under UV light due to fluorescent chemicals in their exoskeleton. The reason is still debated.

cards.name: Whip Scorpion
cards.flavorText: Whip scorpions spray concentrated acetic acid (vinegar) from glands near their tail ‚Äî earning the name vinegaroon.

cards.name: Deathstalker Scorpion
cards.flavorText: The deathstalker's venom contains chlorotoxin, now being researched as a tool to highlight brain tumor cells.

cards.name: Bold Jumping Spider
cards.flavorText: Bold jumping spiders can leap 50 times their body length using hydraulic pressure, not muscles, in their legs.

cards.name: Wolf Spider Matriarch
cards.flavorText: Wolf spiders are nocturnal ground hunters whose eyes produce eyeshine ‚Äî visible when a flashlight hits them.

cards.name: Sydney Funnel-Web
cards.flavorText: The Sydney funnel-web's venom is deadly to primates but harmless to most other mammals ‚Äî an evolutionary fluke.

cards.name: Redback Spider
cards.flavorText: Redback spiders practice sexual cannibalism ‚Äî males somersault into the female's jaws during mating.

cards.name: Brazilian Wandering Spider
cards.flavorText: Brazilian wandering spiders hold the Guinness record for most venomous spider. They hunt actively, never building webs.

cards.name: Tarantula
cards.flavorText: Tarantulas can live over 30 years. They flick barbed urticating hairs from their abdomen to deter predators.

cards.name: Emperor Scorpion
cards.flavorText: Emperor scorpions rely on their massive pincers, not venom, to subdue prey ‚Äî their sting is surprisingly mild.

cards.name: Mother of Spiders
cards.flavorText: Some social spiders share communal webs spanning trees, cooperating to catch prey far larger than themselves.

cards.name: Goliath Birdeater
cards.flavorText: The goliath birdeater weighs up to 175g with a 30cm leg span ‚Äî the world's heaviest spider by mass.

cards.name: Ogre-faced Spider
cards.flavorText: Ogre-faced spiders hold a silk net between their front legs and lunge it over passing prey like a gladiator.

cards.name: Desert Hairy Scorpion
cards.flavorText: At 15 cm long, the desert hairy scorpion detects prey through ground vibrations sensed by slit organs on its legs.

cards.name: Hobo Spider
cards.flavorText: Hobo spiders build funnel-shaped sheet webs and are poor climbers ‚Äî they are almost always found at ground level.

cards.name: Web Bomb
cards.flavorText: Spiders produce up to seven types of silk from different glands, each optimized for a specific function.

cards.name: Ensnare
cards.flavorText: Spider silk is liquid protein that hardens when pulled. The stretching itself triggers molecular alignment.

cards.name: Venom Strike
cards.flavorText: Most spider venom works by dissolving prey from the inside ‚Äî spiders drink their meals as liquefied soup.

params.title: Choose a Webbed creature to strike

cards.name: Swarm
cards.flavorText: A single spider egg sac can contain over 1,000 eggs. Some species guard them; others abandon them to fate.

cards.name: Venomous Bite
cards.flavorText: All spiders except one family (Uloboridae) are venomous. Most are harmless to humans due to tiny fang size.

cards.name: Hunter's Pounce
cards.flavorText: Spiders use hydraulic leg extension ‚Äî pumping fluid into limbs to spring forward. That is why dead spiders curl up.

cards.name: Silk Thread
cards.flavorText: Spider silk is five times stronger than steel by weight and can stretch 40% before breaking.

cards.name: Quick Spin
cards.flavorText: Spiders have up to six spinnerets that work like tiny fingers, braiding multiple silk strands together.

cards.name: Shed Exoskeleton
cards.flavorText: Arachnids must molt to grow. Tarantulas can even regenerate lost legs during the molting process.

cards.name: Venom Spit
cards.flavorText: Spitting spiders eject a toxic silk-glue zigzag over prey from a distance, pinning it to the surface instantly.

cards.name: Silk Trap
cards.flavorText: Spider silk is nearly invisible because individual strands are just 1-20 micrometers thick ‚Äî thinner than human hair.

cards.name: Sticky Web
cards.flavorText: Sticky capture silk uses nanoscale glue droplets that stay adhesive even in high humidity ‚Äî outperforming synthetic tape.

cards.name: Venomous Ambush
cards.flavorText: Many arachnids are ambush predators that can survive months without food by slowing their metabolism to near zero.

cards.name: Trapdoor Ambush
cards.flavorText: Trapdoor spiders can live 20+ years in the same burrow. One Australian specimen was tracked for 43 years.
